image.altText: An Aboriginal man named Bing Crosby and the American singer, Bing Crosby

props.synopsis: Across northern Australia, some Aboriginal people have grown up bearing the names of Hollywood stars and fascist dictators. It's a link back to a dark chapter in history.

title.children: 'The category of domestic animals': Aboriginal people named Hitler, Stalin and Bing Crosby

image.altText: A young girl and a woman can be seen smiling and waving inside a large car

props.synopsis: After 50 days of speculation about the hostages' welfare, this was a huge opportunity for Hamas to present a more human side, but most in the West saw straight through it.

title.children: When Hamas's hostages smile and wave, this is what's actually going on

image.altText: A white woman with brown hair and glasses with a toddler on her lap. The toddler is sipping from a cup

props.synopsis: Many parents with disability experience prejudice and a lack of support services. Here, we meet two mothers creating their own support networks and proving they can parent their way.

title.children: A stranger questioned Louise's ability to parent. Now she's expecting her second baby

image.altText: A storm rolls over Deniliquin

props.synopsis: After two weeks of storms and heavy rainfall lashed Australia's eastern states, there's little doubt that it has been a very wet November for many, defying the odds of a dry weather for spring. So what happened to El Niño?

title.children: November was wet. So what happened to El Niño?

image.altText: two runners on the top of a mountain ridge in regional victoria

props.synopsis: Western Victoria's jagged Grampians mountains have long been a favoured destination for hikers and climbers, but they're also emerging as a must for a new type of fitness fanatic.

title.children: A new breed of super-fit athlete is discovering the rugged trails of Victoria's Grampians and climbers aren't happy

image.altText: Villawood Immigration Detention Centre

props.synopsis: The ABC understands new legislation aimed at locking up some of the non-citizens released following last month's landmark High Court ruling will go to cabinet on Monday morning.

title.children: Federal government to use existing Coalition-era terror laws as a basis for new preventative detention regime

image.altText: Two satellites beam signals back to earth in an artist's impression of the DARC Network.

props.synopsis: A high-tech facility is being built on Western Australia's remote north-west coast as part of AUKUS efforts to improve "deep-space object tracking".

title.children: New AUKUS space facility being built in WA's remote north-west

image.altText: A the upper section of a submarine flying Chinese flags is visible above the sea, a seagul also flies in frame

props.synopsis: Australia will join the US and UK in testing a new way of tracking Chinese submarines using artificial intelligence. The announcement comes a fortnight after Australian naval divers were injured in an incident with a Chinese warship.

title.children: 'This is moving fast': New AUKUS initiative with submarine-tracking AI announced

image.altText: Rescue vehicles drive on a remote beach

props.synopsis: The 25-year-old-man was flown to Brisbane's Alexandra Hospital on Saturday afternoon.

title.children: Man in critical condition after being buried in a sand hole at a campsite on Bribie Island

image.altText: Rows of solar panels. Blue sky dotted with white clouds.

props.synopsis: Australia joins more than 100 other countries across the globe in committing to a tripling of renewable energy capacity by the end of the decade in another coup for the organisers of this year's UN climate talks.

title.children: Australia commits to tripling of renewable energy capacity by end of decade

image.altText: A woman sits at a cafe bench near a car park.

props.synopsis: Tara Byrne, a busy professional, was sold a deal that would reduce her taxable income and provide cost-of-living relief, but the car she signed up for ended up costing more than double its showroom price.

title.children: Tara tried to save some of her pay going to tax but it ended up costing her thousands

image.altText: An elderly man in a blue suit, white shirt, red tie, looks on with a neutral expression

props.synopsis: A US judge rules Donald Trump is not immune from prosecution in his election interference case finding there is no legal basis for concluding that US presidents cannot face criminal charges once they are no longer in office.

title.children: In a US first, judge rules that presidents can be charged with crimes

image.altText: Pink skies and stars over water in Albany, WA.

props.synopsis: Shutterbugs and stargazers were directing their eyes and their lenses upwards at the Aurora Australis, with the iridescent sky show detected in southern and central Australia, on Friday night.

title.children: Aurora Australis 'sparkles' across skies as far north as inland NSW

image.altText: A woman with her mouth wide open and her fists clenched by her sides, wearing a cricket uniform.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Strikers have won consecutive WBBL titles, downing Brisbane Heat by three runs in a nerve-jangling final at Adelaide Oval.

title.children: Adelaide Strikers down Brisbane Heat to win consecutive WBBL titles

image.altText: Athletes wearing blue and green march in the stadium.

props.synopsis: The 2023 Pacific Games officially come to a close with a spectacular night of colour and music, ending a fortnight of incredible sporting achievements from across the Pacific Islands.

title.children: Dance, music and colour: Pacific Games 2023 comes to an end in spectacular style

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's allegation she was raped by former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann in then-minister Linda Reynolds's office has had far-reaching consequences, and perhaps the most extraordinary part of the tale has been playing out in Federal Court this week.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's defamation action was set to be a re-run of his trial, but some key evidence is being revealed

image.altText: A man in black suit sits with a girl in front of North Korea flag.

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un celebrates with scientists and his family after the successful launch of a military spy satellite into orbit.

title.children: Kim Jong Un celebrates North Korea's new 'space power' after spy satellite launch

image.altText: a man in army uniform on the beach pulling an inflatable boat to shore

props.synopsis: In an era of spy satellites and nuclear submarines, Australia's vast northern borders are still being defended by squadrons of soldiers using techniques that are thousands of years old.

title.children: Facing a volatile future, Australia harnesses thousands-year-old techniques to defend remote borders

image.altText: people carry someone on a stretcher while stepping through debris

props.synopsis: After the collapse of the week-long truce, fighting resumes, with Israeli warplanes pounding Gaza and Hamas sending rockets from the enclave into nearby towns.

title.children: Gaza health ministry says more than 170 people killed in Israeli strikes after ceasefire ends

image.altText: A Canadian player contests for the ball alongside an Australian opponent in a women's friendly.

props.synopsis: An experimental Matildas line-up – missing some of the their World Cup stars – are no match for Olympic gold medallists Canada, recording a heavy defeat in the first of two friendlies in British Columbia.

title.children: Inexperienced Matildas fall to Canada 5-0 in opening friendly

image.altText: close up of george santos smiling walking out of capitol building

props.synopsis: Just before his fate was sealed by a history-making vote to expel him from congress, the New York Republican found himself at the centre of another shocking allegation.

title.children: 'To hell with this place': Congress conman George Santos ousted in historic vote after Republicans turn on their own

image.altText: A woman with a trolley stands in a stocked supermarket aisle.

props.synopsis: The product feels lighter, or it's smaller, and you can't quite put your finger on the change… but there is a change. Shrinkflation is becoming more widespread, but can anything be done about it, asks David Taylor.

title.children: 'Shrinkflation' is becoming more widespread, but there's one thing shoppers can do to avoid it

image.altText: An older man and woman smile in front of a well lit house

props.synopsis: Thousands of people descend on Mallee Street in Sydney's Quakers Hill every year to get a look at the Overtons' home, turning their quiet suburban street into a traffic snarl.

title.children: After 30 years of dazzling Christmas lights displays, Peter and Lauraine Overton are calling time

image.altText: The back of Kim Jong Un in front of a rocket launch.

props.synopsis: North Korea says it will consider any interference with its satellite operations a declaration of war and mobilise its war deterrence.

title.children: North Korea says interference with its satellites would be declaration of war

image.altText: A still capture from a video of courtroom footage showing Derek Chauvin at his sentencing hearing, June 2021.

props.synopsis: The complaint alleges that while incarcerated at Federal Correctional Institution Tucson, John Turscak, 52, stabbed Derek Chauvin about 22 times "with an improvised knife".

title.children: Inmate charged with stabbing George Floyd's killer 22 times

image.altText: A couple stand before a house with a burnt forest in the background

props.synopsis: Annie and Allan were in the process of rebuilding the home they lost during the Black Summer bushfires when Allan had to defend it again without the support of RFS alerts or triple-0 calls.

title.children: Couple separated by bushfire furious over five-day mobile service outage during emergency

image.altText: English singer-songwriter, Jessie Ware

props.synopsis: This week, singer Jessie Ware re-lit the disco fire in my soul enough to make me want to go out dancing. But where? There's no dance scene for women my age anymore – and maybe it's been ever thus, writes Virginia Trioli.

title.children: When you're on the 'wrong' side of club-ready, where do you go to dance?

image.altText: A mudskipper fiercely defends its territory from a trespassing crab in Roebuck Bay, Australia.

props.synopsis: Two Australian photographers were chosen from 50,000 entries to make it to the People's Choice shortlist.

title.children: Wildlife Photographer of the Year 2023: Fighting crabs and friendly turtles round out People's Choice finalists
